articles.description: Follow live text and audio commentary from the United States Grand Prix.
articles.title: United States Grand Prix build-up: Leclerc on pole

articles.description: The historic undisputed heavyweight fight between Tyson Fury v Oleksandr Usyk could become part of a superstar double bill, featuring Anthony Joshua's fight against Deontay Wilder.
articles.title: Fury v Usyk & Joshua v Wilder could be a double bill

articles.description: Listen and follow live text updates as Bristol City host Arsenal in weekend's final Women's Super League game.
articles.title: WSL: Build-up to Bristol City v Arsenal - Miedema named on bench

articles.description: Aston Villa continue their fine form under manager Unai Emery by holding off West Ham to move back to the brink of the Premier League's top four.
articles.title: Douglas Luiz double as Villa close in on top four again

articles.description: Follow text updates and BBC Radio 5 Live commentary as Aston Villa host West Ham United in the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Aston Villa v West Ham - radio & text

articles.description: England fought off an impressive Tonga side to win the first match of their three-Test series, Tom Johnstone scoring twice in the second period.
articles.title: England hold off dogged Tonga to win series opener

articles.description: Virat Kohli hits a masterful 95 and Mohammed Shami takes 5-54 as World Cup hosts India beat New Zealand by four wickets.
articles.title: Kohli & Shami lead India to win over New Zealand

articles.description: New Zealand's Mitch Santner and Trent Boult combine brilliantly to run out India batter Suryakumar Yadav during their World Cup match in Dharamsala.
articles.title: Suryakumar run out by 'outrageous' New Zealand fielding

articles.description: Celtic restore their seven-point lead at the top of the Premiership with a comfortable victory over Hearts at Tynecastle.
articles.title: Leaders Celtic brush Hearts aside at Tynecastle

articles.description: Virat Kohli makes a masterful 95 and Mohammed Shami claims 5-54 as World Cup hosts India beat New Zealand by four wickets in Dharamsala.
articles.title: India beat New Zealand to maintain unbeaten run
